data.title: Death Notices and Obituaries
data.meta_description: Death Notices and Obituaries - Huntsville, Ontario, Canada
data.text:
Agnew, Robert

Passed away peacefully on December 30, 2017.

Bob passed away peacefully with his beloved wife Valerie by his side. Loving father of Anette (Charles) Young, Leif Ahlbeck, Cheryl (Chad) Ward, Ray (Tanya) Agnew, Later-in-Life father of Barb Gracey, Dan Pye, Nathan (Terri) Pye, and Amberly (Jason) Pick. Loving and fun-loving, Grandad of Falynn (Paul), Caelen, Tylor, Justin, Alex, Taylor, Emma, and Piper. Great Grandad of Aurora. Bob was predeceased by his brother Darlow.

Bob lived life on his own terms; spending time with family was his highest priority. He also enjoyed playing pool and shuffleboard at the Legion, the occasional golf game with his buddies, and getting together with friends over a beer or three. Bob took on a variety of roles within the Legion, consistently working towards the best interests of the members. His sense of humour was always in evidence, and if you stopped in for a visit you would be welcomed with a smile, a beer (if you liked Export!) and always the possibility of a mini chocolate bar. Bob fought the good fight over the last 2 years, and the family would like to recognize the wonderful care he received from Dr. Greg Stewart, Dr. Jennifer MacMillan, and the Home Care nurses – in particular Heather, Tonya, and Sarah, who have all become honorary members of our family.

A Celebration of Life will be held at the Royal Canadian Legion 21 Veterans Way, Huntsville on Saturday January 6, 2018 from 1:00 to 4:00 p.m.

Memorial Gifts to Huntsville Hospice would be welcomed.

Arrangements are entrusted to Billingsley Funeral Home.

BAIN, Marilyn Joan

Marilyn Joan Bain born on March 30, 1935 died peacefully at Hilltop Manor in Cambridge at 4:30 am on December 26. Born and raised in Huntsville, Marilyn is the daughter of the late Ross and Norma Goldthorpe and sister of the late brothers, Calvin and Brian Goldthorpe.

Marilyn is the mother of Cheryl and Gary O’Brien, and Bryan and Lilly Bain. Grandmother to Chris, Laura, Sarah, Ashley, Cameron, Amanda and Andrew, as well as 8 Great Grandchildren.

As per Marilyn’s request, there will be no viewings or funeral service.

Marilyn had a passion for snow skiing and bridge. This brought her many wonderful friendships and adventures. She will be greatly missed by family and friends.

www.mitchellfuneralhome.ca

Mary Elizabeth Elliott

It is with much sadness that the family announces the passing of Mary Elizabeth Elliott (nee Campbell) on Sunday December 24, 2017 at the age of 88.

Beloved wife of the late Robert Elliott. Dear mother of Sandra and her husband Ron Waines; Chris and his wife Barb; and Brian. Predeceased by her eldest son Terry. Loving grandmother to Jordan and Hillary. Survived by her sister Faith Campbell, and her brother Peter Campbell and his wife Virginia.

Mary will be fondly missed and never forgotten.

Family and friends are invited to gather at the Mitchell Funeral Home, 15 High Street, Huntsville on Saturday January 6, 2018 from 1:00 – 3:00 pm. Remembrances at 2:00 pm.

Memorial donations may be made to Huntsville Hospital Auxiliary or Huntsville Hospital Foundation.

www.mitchellfuneralhome.ca

In lieu of flowers, donations to either the Canadian Cancer Society or the Canadian Diabetes Association, would be appreciated by the family.

www.mitchellfuneralhome.ca

Patricia “Pat” Gilchrist

The death occurred at her home in Huntsville on Saturday, December 9, 2017 of Patricia ( Pat) Gilchrist.

Beloved daughter of the late Jack and Evelyn Gilchrist.

Pat was a graduate of the Ontario Ladies’ College, Whitby and a graduate of the University of Toronto with a Bachelor of Arts degree. She also studied at Laval University in Quebec, the University of Mexico and at a university in Germany. She travelled extensively. Her career was as a legal secretary. Pat was a great granddaughter of Andrew Tait who had a lumber business in Huntsville and Orillia. Her ashes will be interred alongside her mother Evelyn Tait Gilchrist in the Tait family plot in Orillia.

Glenna Ellen Marie Russell (nee Mitchell)

1950 – 2017

It is with great sadness that we announce the passing of our loving wife, mother and grandmother on December 11, 2017 at the age of 67 years. As she passed into the presence of her heavenly Father, she was surrounded by the love of her life, children and grandchildren.

Glenna will be lovingly remembered by her husband of 46 years, Don and three children; Aaron (Laurie) Russell, daughters Sara and Hannah of Huntsville; Callum (Treena) Russell, and their children Mitchell and Madison (fiancé, Ian Scantland) all of Three Hills AB, Melanie Russell and Dan Barkwell, and their children Caleb and Ava all of Huntsville, ON. She is also survived by her mother Mary Radford (Mitchell), and two sisters Suzanne (David) Ward of Stirling, ON and Bev (Larry) Offner of Huntsville, ON. She is also survived by numerous nieces, nephews, and close friends. She was predeceased by her father Gordon Mitchell.

Glenna treasured her family. She was a devoted wife, mother and grandmother. She found great joy in time spent with her grandchildren. Glenna spent her life serving in ministry – whether at church or camps like Frontier Lodge, IAWAH, Teen Ranch and Camp Mini-Yo-We, and as Dean of Women at Prairie Bible College. She had a heart for helping others – this was evident in her career calling as a Counselor and Mental Health Crisis Worker.

Although we are grieving, and miss her; we take comfort in knowing her pain has come to an end. We rejoice that she is sitting at the feet of Jesus; and by the promises of her Lord and Saviour, her body has been made anew.

Relatives and friends are invited to meet the family at Billingsley Funeral Home (billingsleyfuneralhome.com) on Friday December 15th from 1 to 3pm and 6 to 8pm. A Celebration of Life will be held at Faith Baptist Church (faithmuskoka.ca) on Saturday December 16th at 11am. Reception to follow.

We would like to thank Dr. Andy MacMillan, Dr. Pamela McDermott, CCAC, homecare nurses, and Hospice Huntsville for the compassionate care they provided for mom.

If friends so desire, memorial tributes in Glenna’s name may be made directly to Hospice Huntsville (hospicehuntsville.com), or Faith Baptist Church Youth Programs (faithmuskoka.ca).

Diana Vivian Roberts, 1922 – 2017

It is with a mix of great sadness and joyful celebration, that we announce the passing of Diana Vivian Roberts (nee Hall). A pillar to many, a dutiful and loving mother to her daughter, Gail (Jim); a hero to her grandsons Christian (Tamara), Shaun and Michael (Jennifer) and a fine example of a strong, independent and resourceful woman to her grandchildren Hannah, Hayden and Haileigh, captures a life well-lived. She is also survived by her sister-in-law Connie Clark (Peter), son-in-law Stephen Bryon and brother-in-law Ian Roberts (Mary-lee).

“Nana” Robert’s 95 years were filled with service to her adopted communities of Huntsville and Lake of Bays as well as her country (Britain), her loyalty to her immediate family (husband Llewellyn, daughter Victoria and grandson Christian, all predeceased), her love for her brothers John and Tam Hall, loving sister Madge Dickinson (all predeceased), and her five (5) decades of focused and unwavering professionalism and dedication to one of humanity’s most noble professions: Nursing. She also held a very special place in her heart for Huntsville District Memorial Hospital, having served as the hospital’s Director of Nursing from 1970 to 1987.

A celebration of her life will take place on Friday, December 1, 2017 at 12:30 p.m. at St. Ambrose Anglican Church in Baysville.

In lieu of flowers, the family is asking for a donation to be made in her honour to the Huntsville District Memorial Hospital or Veteran Care Centre at Sunnybrook Hospital, from where she received excellent care during the last months of her life.

WALTON, WILLIAM “KEITH”

On Monday, November 13, William “Keith” Walton, devoted and compassionate husband, dad and grampy, loyal son and brother and committed friend to so many, died suddenly and much too soon, surrounded by the love and adoration of his family.

Keith leaves a giant hole in our hearts and will be missed by so many: his wife Jo; his children and partners Kyle and Emily, Jessie, Luke and Emma, Kayla and Cody; his grandsons Davyn and Jackson; siblings Ken and Carol, Cheryl and Phil, Lynne and Chuck; father-in-law Harold; inlaws Jennifer, Jeff and Laura, and Jacqueline and Mike; and his beloved dog Wally. Keith will also be fondly remembered by his many nieces, nephews, extended family and dear friends. He is predeceased by his mother Margaret; dad Jack; mother-in-law Evelyn; and brother-in-law Geoff (Hicke).

Keith was an inspiring example of integrity, loyalty and commitment in his role as superintendent at the Mark O’Meara Golf Course at Grandview. He was a passionate community supporter and proud member of the Stephenson District Lions Club, avid curler, an expert fire-tender and maple syrup maker. With Keith’s passing, we’ve truly lost one of the great ones. Heartfelt thanks to the compassionate staff at the Stratford General Hospital.

The family invites everyone to join them for a Bonfire, at their home

61 Northwoods Drive, Port Sydney

Saturday November 18, 2017

4:00 ~ 9:00 p.m.

A Celebration of Life will be held at The Mark O’Meara Club House

Sunday November 19, 2017 from 1:00 ~ 5:00 p.m.

Reflections at 2:00 p.m.

Keith was an avid blood donor, donating 114 times—in lieu of flowers, please consider donating at a clinic being held in his memory on Saturday December 16, 2017 at the Huntsville Summit Centre, 20 Park Drive Huntsville from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.

Visit blood.ca to book an appointment. Donations can also be made to one of his favourite causes the Movember Foundation at Arrangements entrusted to the Billingsley Funeral Home.

YOUNG-BRUYNS MARY ELLEN

It is with sad hearts that we announce the passing of Ellen Young-Bruyns on November 12, 2017 at the age of 49 years, after a short, courageous battle with cancer.

She leaves behind her loving husband Jack Bruyns, her children Tonia (Ryan O’Donnell), Brandon, Devon, Dan (Treena), David (Lyn), Barb (Dan Perrault) and Shane (Kammi). She lives on in the memories of her beloved grandchildren Nathan, Liam, Natasha, Christopher, Sarina, Lauren, Jessica, Lucas and Tyler. Forever in the hearts of her great grandchildren Courtney, Briley, Anne Marie and Takara. Will be greatly missed by her siblings, Francis, Valerie (Gord), David (Wendy), Debbie (Tom) and Bill.

Ellen made a huge impact on those around her and words cannot begin to describe the heartache so many feel right now. She was a caring wife, amazing mom and stepmom and the world’s best grandma. Her smile, laughter and love will be missed and never forgotten.

Celebration of Life Reception will be held at the Dwight Community Centre, 1014 Dwight Beach Road, Dwight, Ontario on Saturday November 25, 2017 from 1:00 to 5:00 p.m.

‘We know you are smiling down on us every day. Until we meet again, Lots of love from everyone you touched.’

In Loving Memory of Mr. Edmund Pimentel

Edmund was born the youngest of seven boys on August 12, 1947 in the village of Pilar, Bretanha in the Açores of Portugal. His family made the journey to Canada in 1963 and settled in the west end of Toronto. His outgoing nature and love of music naturally brought together a close knit community of friends and family. Within this community he met his future wife and best friend Carmen. Soon after their marriage in 1972, they moved out of the city limits to Bramalea and began to raise a family. Edmund and Carmen along with their three daughters Jennifer, Valerie and Stephanie stayed in their home on Mancroft for over three decades. All the while “Eddie,” as he was affectionately known, would work long days in the printing business (for many years at Stanley Manufacturing and would go on to start his own business PSI Graphics) but saved nights and weekends for playing and performing in his band – Boa Esperança. As the girls grew up, Eddie began to feel the pull northward to cottage country. He found a waterfront lot in Mckellar where he brought his family up for entire summers and any free weekends to enjoy the quiet outdoors. He eventually built the family cottage that became the heart of the extended family where reunions, parties and weddings would play host. Anyone lucky enough to attend one of the many gatherings held at the cottage knew they were in for a joyful time of great food, plenty of laughs and the always memorable campfire sing-a-long with Eddie’s acoustic guitar at the center of it all.

In the fall of 2015, Eddie and Carmen moved to Huntsville to be closer to family. Jennifer and her husband Jonathan had made Huntsville home in 2007, followed by Valerie and her husband Greg in 2010. In 2011 Valerie and Greg welcomed their daughter Leila into the world followed by their son Nathan in 2013. Eddie “Avô” and Carmen “Avó” were delighted with the idea of being grandparents and the chance to play a role in their upbringing.

Edmund is survived by his beloved wife Carmen, three daughters Jennifer (Jonathan), Valerie (Greg) and Stephanie and adoring grandchildren Leila and Nathan. Brother Peter (Olga) Pimentel, sister-in-law Gloria (Manuel). Predeceased by father Joao and mother Violante, brothers Manuel (Gloria), John, Joe (Arminda), Edmundo and Pedro.

Visitation: Billingsley Funeral Home, 430 Ravenscliffe Road, Huntsville, Ontario on Sunday November 12, 2017 from 2:00 – 4:00 & 7:00 – 9:00 p.m.

Funeral Service: Billingsley Funeral Home, 430 Ravenscliffe Road, Huntsville, Ontario on Monday November 13, 2017 at 2:30 p.m. Reverend Derek Shelly officiating. Interment Hutcheson Memorial Cemetery.

Donald Waltfred Clark

October 28, 1926 to November 7, 2017.

Don died at the Algonquin Grace Hospice in Huntsville, Ontario. He is survived by his dear wife Ritsu (nee Kameda) and brother David, and will be fondly remembered by his children Mary (Bernard), Michael, Paula (Bill), Timothy (Melanie), John (Vanessa), Christopher (Donna) and Thomas (Shelly), grandchildren Simone, Laurier, Jonathan, Kyle, Cole, Leanna, Dylan, Isobel, Di-yet, Geordan, Kimiko, Peter, Michael, Carlos, William, Anna and Hope; and great-grandchildren Penelope, Harriet, Charlotte, Benjamin, Fitzgerald, Skyler, Samara, Taiya and Zoe.

Donald Waltfred Clark was born October 28, 1926 in Alhambra, California of Canadian parents and raised in Toronto. In 1938 his family moved to Niagara Falls, NY, where he attended high school and university. After serving in the US Navy 1944-46, he finished a Bachelor’s degree at North Texas State University. Don joined the Episcopal Church in Texas and studied at Trinity College, University of Toronto, where he obtained his Licence in Theology (LTh) and Bachelor of Sacred Theology (STB) degree. In 1951 he married Ritsu Kameda in Toronto, and in1952 was ordained a priest in Texas.

Don served 14 years served as parish priest in the US before moving to Toronto in 1965 to work for the Anglican Church of Canada. In the following years he served in churches in Toronto, Oakville, Windsor and Fort McMurray. In between he completed a Master’s in Religious Studies at the University of Windsor and two years of study at the Toronto School of Theology. In 1991 he and Ritsu retired to Muskoka, where they had had a summer home on Bella Lake since 1967. Don served as Honourary Associate Priest at All Saints’Church in Huntsville for two decades.

Visitation will be on Sunday, November 12, from 11:30 am to 1:30 pm at the Mitchell Funeral Home, 15 High Street, Huntsville, Ontario. A Funeral Service will be held on Monday, November 13, at 1 pm at All Saints’ Anglican Church, 30 High Street, Huntsville, preceded by visitation in the church chapel from noon to 12:45 pm. The Service will be followed by a reception in Sutherland Hall.

Don’s family wishes to thank the staff and volunteers of Algonquin Grace Hospice for the comfort given and compassion shown to them and to Don.

Donations in lieu of flowers can be given to the Memorial Fund at All Saints Church or to Hospice Huntsville.

MAZURK, DAVID CHARLES

Passed on to glory peacefully at Kingston General Hospital on Sunday November 5, 2017 at the age of 85. David is predeceased by his loving wife, Joan Lenore Mazurk (March 2012). David was born September 11, 1932 to parents Eric and Audrey (nee Dunn) Mazurk in Oxfordshire, England.

Beloved Father of Jane (Robert) Valiquette, Christine (Lino) Fera, David Wayne (Connie) Mazurk and Cheryl (Stephen) Heathcock. Loving Grandfather to Stephen (Chrissy) Valiquette and Sarah (Ian) Thompson; Rebecca (Josh) and Brent Fera; Matthew (Ashley) Mazurk, Krista (Bobby) Fournier and Jesse Mazurk; Rachel, Jacob, Caleb and Isaac Heathcock. Loving Great Grandfather to Dalton and Dean Valiquette, Hailey-Jane and Harvey Valiquette, Elijah and Aria Fournier.

David was Director at Christian Horizons Group Home, Bracebridge, Ontario until his retirement at age 65. David was a firm believer in God and was an active member of Faith Baptist Church, Huntsville, Ontario where he participated in small group bible studies and the Keenagers Group. He also enjoyed the Muskoka Seniors where he was a community volunteer driver.

Visitation will be held at the Billingsley Funeral Home, 430 Ravenscliffe Rd., Huntsville on Sunday November 12, 2017 from 6 to 8 pm. Visitation will also be held Monday November 13, 2017 from 10 to11 am. at Faith Baptist Church, Huntsville.

Funeral Service will be held at Faith Baptist Church, 169 West Road, Huntsville on Monday, November 13, 2017 at 11 am. Conducted by Pastor Darrell Baker and Pastor Stephen Heathcock. Internment will take place at Stephenson Cemetery in Port Sydney following the service. Memorial gifts, if desired, may be sent to Faith Baptist Church and The Gideon Foundation

Ms. Alice Bertha May Goss

It is with sadness that we announce the passing of our Mother/Grandmother, Alice Bertha May Goss (nee Green), at the age of 86 at Muskoka Shores, Gravenhurst on Sunday, October 1, 2017.

Mom was born August 1, 1931 to Martha Jane (nee Cain) and Allan Green.

Dear Mother of Linda (John) Charby, Robert (Diana), Sandy (Jamie) Godfrey, Patricia Godfrey, Bonnie Kennedy and Ruth Woolvett.

Grandmother of Tammy, Jason, David, Cheryl, Lori, Angela, Robert Jr., Adam, Brenda, Tina, Tim, Beverley, Dan, Chelsea, Lindsay and Allison.

Great-grandmother of 24 and great-great-grandmother of 5.

Pre-deceased by husband Lloyd Godfrey and brothers Don Green and Albert Green.

Remembered by sister-in-law Violet Green.

As we reminisce, we remember Mom/Grandma enjoying watching the Hamilton Tiger-cats while eating spoonfuls of peanut butter, star-gazing, her sweet-tooth, her love of animals and birds (especially seagulls and owls), and her being mesmerized admiring family’s jewellery as they visited with her. During her days at Muskoka Shores in Gravenhurst she would love to be taken to Gull Lake Park. While there having picnics she shared most of her food with the seagulls.

Mom didn’t venture out often and loved watching travel shows and would say “I have travelled the world from my lazy boy”. As you travel in Heaven, may we remember:

Do not stand at my grave and weep

I am not there, I do not sleep.

I am a thousand winds that blow,

I am the diamond glints on snow,

I am the sunset on ripened grain,

I am the gentle autumn’s rain.

When you awaken in the morning’s hush,

I am the sweet uplifting rush,

Of quiet birds in circled flight,

I am the soft stars that shine at night.

Do not stand at my grave and cry

I am not there, I did not die.

Cremation has taken place and a private, family gathering will be held at a later date.

If considering a donation, The Alzheimer Society or The Ontario SPCA would be appreciated.

We wish to thank all Mom’s caregivers over the years and especially thank those special ones from Muskoka Shores.

www.mitchellfuneralhome.ca

In Loving Memory of Mr. John Yearley

Passed away peacefully at his home in Yearley on September 4, 2017.

John was born at Yearley on May 27, 1936 to parents Rupert and Margaret Yearley. He married Vera (nee Whitehead) on October 12, 1953 in Huntsville and together they raised five children. In his younger years John cut Christmas trees, pulp wood, worked in saw mills and did construction work. He started working as an apprentice, then got his Plumber’s License at Parrot’s Plumbing and Heating. In the 70’s he started his own plumbing and heating business with his sons. When he retired he moved to Yearley to the log house he built and had used as a hunting camp for many years. He always loved hunting, fishing, travelling and cutting his own wood. John and Vera were members of the Stisted Fall Fair and for years John sat as a director on their board. Every year he supplied the rope for the tug-of-war. He enjoyed dancing and was a member, then president of the Yearley Seniors Club. John will always be remembered for his love of family and his stories or jokes that he always had at the ready.

Beloved husband of the late Vera, Dear father of Linda (Doug) Hayes of Novar, Debbie (Dave) Mechetuck of Campbellford, Bill of Yearley, David (Janice) of Huntsville. Predeceased by his son Jack and daughter-in-law Peggy. Loving grandfather of nine, Great grandfather of ten, Great great grandfather of four. Predeceased by his grandson Jack. All were cherished by John. Dear brother of Mary Grasley and Norm (June). Predeceased by his sisters Violet Bigelow and Sadie Aitcheson.

A Graveside service will be held at Yearley Union Cemetery on Saturday, September 30, 2017 at 2:00 p.m. Reverend Vito Booth officiating. Reception to follow at the Aspdin Community Centre. Memorial Gifts to the Stisted Fall Fair or the charity of one’s choice would be appreciated by the family.

MATTON, ELAINE MARIE

After a courageous 10 year battle with cancer, Elaine Matton died peacefully on July 12, 2017 at Algonquin Grace Hospice in Huntsville with her family by her side.

Survived by husband Reid Perrin of Huntsville, mother Evelyn Matton of London (predeceased by her father Leo Matton), step son Brant Perrin, sister Joanne Hoos (John) of Gravenhurst, nephews Christopher Hoos ( Alicia), Cameron Hoos ( Kaitlyn), great nephew Dylan, nieces Zoe and Scottie all of Bracebridge.

Born in Windsor April 17, 1953. Moved to London in 1955. Elaine left a promising Supervisor career with the Ontario Government in Toronto in 1985 to purchase Divine Lake Resort in Port Sydney and moved to Muskoka.

The resort was sold in 1990 and Elaine took the opportunity to pursue her entrepreneurship dreams, and alone developed, from the ground up, the largest successful cottage rental business in Canada of that time.

During the last years of dealing with cancer, Elaine (self employed) built up several other small businesses and crafts from her country home near Port Sydney.

A Private Service has been held at the Billingsley Funeral Home, Huntsville. The family wishes to thank Dr. Harrold and the Algonquin Grace Hospice Staff for their excellent care. Memorial Gifts to Hospice Huntsville would be appreciated by the family. www.billingsleyfuneralhome.com

HOCKIN, John David:

John David Hockin born August 12th, 1941 passed away after a year-long battle with cancer on July 8th, 2017 in Huntsville, Ontario surrounded by his loving family. He will be greatly missed by his wife Heather, brother Tom (Mary), children John (Lisa) and Carrie (Jeff) Watt, granddaughters, nieces and nephews. He was predeceased by his brother Peter in 2005.

David was born in London, Ontario, son of Thomas and Margaret, and enjoyed summers at Lake Huron and Camp Hurontario with brothers Tom and Peter. He met his intellectual equal and life-long love Heather at the University of Western Ontario. They celebrated 50 years of marriage in 2015 with friends and family at their cottage on Lake of Bays. Both David and Heather graduated from the Ivey Business School in 1965 and David went on to be a member of the first graduating class of the MBA program at York University in 1967.

David embraced and thrived in a variety of business roles highlighted by his 15 years as President of Stafford Foods. He also served as President of Hunt Wesson Foods Canada, Vice President of Imperial Life and Vice President of Ontario Blue Cross/Blue Shield. On the weekends, he instilled his strong work ethic in his children, completing building projects at several cottage properties between Georgian Bay and Lake of Bays. He also made time for fun with his friends, family and toys – from his hand-built Seaflea speedboat to his Piper Cub airplane. David enjoyed golf and served on the Board at Panther Woods Country Club in Florida and was President of Men’s Golf at Deerhurst Lakeside. He helped launch the Probus Club in Huntsville, served as a Warden at Grassmere Church and delivered Meals on Wheels.

David was an extremely proud Grandpa and Big D to Haley, Emily, Annie, Audrey, Sophie and Meredith. He cheered on all their accomplishments, gave them their first taste of beer, and made them personalized paddles for our annual family Olympics.

Our family would like thank Dr. David Mathies and the doctors, nurses and medical practitioners at Huntsville Hospital, CCAC and Hospice Huntsville for their compassionate care for David in his final journey.

A Memorial Service will be held Tuesday July 25th at 2:00 p.m. at Trinity United Church, 33 Main St East, Huntsville, Ontario. A reception will follow at Mark O’Meara Grandview Golf Club, 245 Grandview Dr. North, Huntsville, Ontario.

If desired, memorial donations may be made to Hospice Huntsville or the Huntsville Hospital Foundation. www.mitchellfuneralhome.ca

Proud grandmother of Melissa (Dave), Andrea (Chris), Melissa (Joey), Stefanie, Erica (Chad), Dustin (Nicole), Laura and Adam (Carrie). Survived by her sisters Laura McCluskie and Marion Smith, brother Robert Aelick, sisters in law Noreen Aelic and Grace Aelick. She will be lovingly missed by her many nieces and nephews.

Eileen moved to Dwight as a young bride at the age of 18, and embraced her new community. Over the years she belonged to the Dwight UCW, Woman’s Institute, and was a CGIT leader, Sunday School teacher and active in the Home & School Association. When St. Peter’s Church closed, she joined the congregation at Stewart Memorial Church in Dwight. She remained a devoted member her entire life.
